page.title: 19Hampton Arts and Crafts
page.content: In{Hampton-in-Arden}there is a local {Arts and Crafts Society.}Each year they hold an Arts and Crafts Exhibition in the village at Fentham Hall. The{Exhibition}takes place on a Saturday and Sunday and about 700 people usually visit it, with the busiest times being for coffee in the mornings and tea and cakes in the afternoons. There are usually about 40 exhibitors, 18 of which are local artists ranging from self-taught amateurs to professionally-taught artists. About 30 to 40 of the visitors actually buy paintings. Work by other craftsmen is on show and there is also a display of work by children from the village school. One of the local craftswomen, Mrs. Beechey visits the school once a week to run a {needlework club}for about 20 of the children who make clothes and softtoys
